messages.title: Minor Injury Unit Closing Early
messages.content: Focus fighting to keep it open until 9pm.

messages.title: X-ray victory
messages.content: But health chiefs have agreed to increase services on weekends - because they are busy. They tried to drop the hours to focus attention on their new unit and warned them it wouldn't work. We fought to keep the hours.

messages.title: Caring about You and Yate
messages.content: Steve Webb & Focus Team members with copies of their petition.

messages.title: Let's Get Yate Moving
messages.content: Focus puts in FOI request. An FOI was put to add your name to our petition calling for action on safe roads and public transport - you don't have to tolerate dangerous, bumpy pavements, slow buses or lack of off-highway cycle routes to the town.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Keeping the Minor Injury Unit open until 9pm and ensuring X-ray services are available on weekends due to high demand.
Improving transport in Yate with a focus on safe roads, better public transport options, and cyclist safety.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Don't forget 7 May. You get one election day to keep your MP and local services. Vote for Steve Webb, your experienced local MP.

issues.health: Focus Team is fighting to keep the Minor Injury Unit open until 9pm. But health chiefs have agreed to increase services on weekends.

images.caption: Steve Webb going through the thousands of replies to his 2015 health survey.
Steve Webb with Focus Team members.
Steve Webb & Focus Team members with copies of their petition.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet contains various updates on local issues, demonstrating a strong focus on the specific needs of the community of Yate, like health services and transport.
